attributes.text: @dev This helper function is a fast and cheap way to convert between IERC20[] and IAsset[] types

params.amnt: amount of investment (subscription capital) accepted by issuer for which allotment of security tokens are made to investor
params.asset: address of asset which is used by investor to subscribe to the issue
params.poolid: identifier of primary issue pool in which subscription is made by investor

params._token: address of token allocated earlier to asset manager (message sender)

params._security: identifier for the security token offered

params.poolId: identifier for a primary issue pool for which subscribers are to be returned

params._factory: reference to the primary issue pool factory contract
params._products: reference to the Verified Products contract that this contract reports created primary issue pools to
params._swapFeePercentage: percentage of trading fee to be charged by the asset manager

params.cutoffTime: time in milliseconds by when offer closes
params.security: security offered to the primary issue pool

params.desired: is the amount required of the liquidity token to be paired
params.docs: is the ipfs address of the offering docs
params.isin: is the identifier for the security token offered
params.min: is the minimum amount to be swapped of the 'offered' token
params.owned: is the security or settlement token on offer
params.owner: is the current holder of the owned token that is offered
params.tomatch: is the liquidity token that is required to be paired

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

params.poolid: identifier for primary issue pool to which investor has subscribed

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

params._amount: amount of tokens staked to provide liquidity for underwriting investments in tokenized securities

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

accept(bytes32,address,uint256,address,b.notice: Called by issuer to accept subscription to issue by investor

close(address,bool,bytes32,uint8,bytes32.notice: Called by issuer to close subscription of 'security' issued by it

getAllotedStake(address).notice: Gets liquidity allotted for asset manager (message sender)

getLiquidityProviders(address).notice: Fetches liquidity providers for a security token

getOffered(address).notice: Gets tokens to match for offered token

getSubscribers(bytes32,bytes32,uint8,byt.notice: Fetches investors (subscribers) to a primary issue pool

issue(address,uint256,address,bytes32,ui.notice: Called by issuer of 'security' token to open an issue which will last till 'cutoffTime'

offer(address,bytes32,uint256,address,ui.notice: Called by market maker and issuer for adding liquidity

reject(bytes32,address,bytes32,uint8,byt.notice: Called by issuer to reject subscription to issue by investor

settle(bytes32,bytes32,uint8,bytes32,byt.notice: Called by product issuer to settle distribution of fee income arising from investment underwritten in the primary issue pool

stake(uint256,address,address).notice: Called by Liquidity token contract to stake tokens by investors
